section.title: Overview
section.p: All application alarms are written to the SPSAlarm.log instead of SPSServer.log on respective nodes. The size of the primary alarm log file can be maximum 30 MB and rotation policy is applied based on the size of the file. On every successful rolling of the log file, a new compressed .gz file is created. A maximum of 15 such backup files can be kept at a time. Anything older than that is removed from the file system.
The application alarms are the following:

note.p: AutoClear is described in the following tables as being "yes" or "no". AutoClear: yes means that the alarm will be cleared immediately after it is raised. AutoClear: no means that the alarm will be cleared once the condition or scenario has recovered from whatever caused the alarm.

The Alarm ID given for each alarm in all of these tables is displayed on NCC for all alarms. When the NokiaEmsMib MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is not sent in the SNMP trap. However, when the NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionSuiteAlarmIrp MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is sent in the SNMP trap.

note.p: Device Lookup Failed Alarm and Barring State Alarm are also raised by Sy.

section.title: Subscriber Model and Lifecycle alarms
section.p: The following table lists Subscriber Model and Lifecycle alarms.

note.p: All alarms listed in the following table have Specific-Problem and Additional-Text values containing one or more new lines (i.e. "/n") as returned by the application's error handling code in the Subscriber Model and LifeCycle resource bundles. As a result, when a given alarm is raised in a standalone system the Specific-Problem and Additional-Text is logged to SPSAlarm.log with new lines represented in the logs. In distributed CSF deployments, the new lines are present in the associated SNMP trap variable bindings for Specific-Problem and Additional-Text. The representation of new lines can vary from one SNMP Manager to the next. If for some reason, issues are encountered relating to the presence of new lines in the SNMP trap variable bindings for Specific-Problem and Additional-Text, contact Nokia Support for more information.
